snippet: United Nations officials call the influx a devastating milestone in the humanitarian crisis created by the Syrian civil war.
abstract: United Nations reports number of registered Syrian war refugees who have flooded into Lebanon exceeded one million, with new refugees still coming as the civil war grinds into its fourth year; says influx is devastating milestone in a humanitarian crisis that has overwhelmed the small country and severely taxed the ability of the government and aid organizations.
lead_paragraph: United Nations officials call the influx a devastating milestone in the humanitarian crisis created by the Syrian civil war.

headline.main: Lebanon Hosts Over a Million Who Fled Syria, U.N. Reports
headline.print_headline: Lebanon Hosts Over a Million Who Fled Syria, U.N. Reports
